abstracts.cdata!:
The environmental assessment stipulates
            adverse effects, on several fronts, due to the
            implementation of the Ouagadougou Water Supply Project. The
            conclusions are global, taking both stages, prior to
            construction, and, post implementation of the project. The
            environmental physical and biological concerns, include
            negative effects on crops, as well as on certain animal
            species. Nonetheless, these are expected to be temporary
            impacts, whereas aquaculture will benefit positively.
            Regarding the socioeconomic front, negative effects are
            considered, namely, due to resettlement. Public health
            however, is expected to benefit due to water improvements.
            The proposed mitigation measures are: 1) adequate water
            control through simulation models, optimizing water usage,
            at the same time, diminishing the possibility of flood risks
            during the reservoir construction; 2) creation of a special
            fund which will financially contribute to the negative tax
            liabilities, and/or tariff losses in water consumption; 3)
            adequate specifications and construction work control,
            through the installation of alarm devices, thus preventing
            reservoir breaching risks; and 4) public health awareness,
            through food aid coordination, particularly to affected
            families. Further measures are recommended for disease
            control. A two year period, prior to resettlement, is
            recommended for rendering new lands for normal production at
            resettlement time.
